title: Sri Lanka schedules 3 hour power cut on April 22
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Power cuts of 3 hours and 20 minutes have been approved for Sri Lanka for April 22, Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said as forex shortages due to money printing by the central bank triggered forex shortages disrupting fuel imports.
All Areas (ABCDEFGHIJKLPQRSTUVW) will have power cuts of 2 hours from 0900am to 0500pm and 1 hour and 20 minutes from 0500pm and 0900pm.
The Ceylon Electricity Board said 1130 cubic meters of high sulfur fuel oil was received at Sapugaskande.

Engineers at the Lakvijaya coal power complex had had warned the management that foreign exchange shortages have blocked spare parts imports. At least two plants are overdue for major overhauls by two years as spares for routine maintenance started to run out, they have said.
Sri Lanka coal power plants at breakdown risk without spare parts
Earlier in the day Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said 48 million US dollars had been paid for two coal ships.

Though rains have started to come, Sri Lanka is still facing severe forex shortages from a flexible exchange rate (intermediate regime soft-peg). An attempt to float the currency (suspend convertibility) has not succeeded amid a surrender requirement.(Colombo/ April 22/2022)
